1.texto:
The East Wind, an interloper in the dominions of Westerly Weather, is an impassive-faced tyrant with a sharp poniard held behind his back for a treacherous stab.
-Joseph Conrad, The Mirror of the Sea

2.descricao: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
2.texto: Early Jamuraan hunters devised a weapon that would return to its source. Tolarian Æthermancers developed a spell that skipped the weapon entirely.

4.descricao:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

Cloud Sprite can block only creatures with flying.
4.texto: The delicate sprites carry messages for Saprazzans, but they refuse to land in Mercadia City's filthy markets.

5.descricao: Counter target spell. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that spell and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

regras.texto: Counterbore has no effect on cards on the battlefield that have the same name as the targeted spell.
The cards you're searching for must be found if they're in the graveyard, because that's a zone everyone can see. Finding those cards in the hand and library is optional, though.

In most cases, Counterbore will exile the targeted spell. Its first sentence counters the spell, which puts it into its owner's graveyard. Its second sentence then removes it from the graveyard. However, there are some exceptions to this, as listed below.

If the spell's controller isn't the same as its owner (due to Commandeer, for example), it won't be exiled. The spell is countered and put into its owner's graveyard. Then the spell's controller's graveyard, hand, and library are searched.

If the targeted spell can't be countered (it's Vexing Shusher, for example), that spell will remain on the stack. Counterbore will continue to resolve. You still get to search for and exile all other cards with that name.

6.texto:
From the sea came all life, and to the sea it will return. The sooner the better.
—Emperor Aboshan

7.descricao: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.
7.texto: According to merfolk legend, a denizen of the deep swallows the horizon at the end of each day, bringing on the cold blanket of night.

8.texto: Some wizards compete not to summon the most interesting creatures, but to create the most interesting aftereffects when a summons goes awry.

regras.texto: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

9.descricao: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
9.texto:
Once I supply the breeze, you'll see your warriors for the smoke they truly are.
—Alexi, zephyr mage

10.descricao: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
10.texto: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

11.descricao:
Enchant creature

You control enchanted creature.
11.texto:
“Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?”
-Jace Beleren

regras.texto: Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

12.texto: Fragments of thought refract and multiply, surging in a geyser of dizzying insight.

13.texto: Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no.

regras.texto: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

14.texto:
The construction of a defense is not accomplished by adding bricks.
-Jace Beleren

15.texto: Foul-tempered, poorly trained, and mule-stubborn, the drake is the perfect test of the master's will.

16.descricao:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
16.texto: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies collect jewels for theirs.

17.descricao: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
17.texto: Mages routinely summon creatures from the Æther. It’s only fair that they occasionally throw one back.

18.descricao:
Flying

Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
18.texto: To gaze under its hood is to invite death.

19.descricao:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

Other black creatures get +1/+1.

Nonblack creatures get -1/-1.
19.texto: His soul snared by an angel's curse, Crovax twisted heroism into its purest shadow.

regras.texto: If Ascendant Evincar stops being black, it gives itself -1/-1.

20.descricao:
Spend only black mana on X.

Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.

regras.texto: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number chosen for X, not the amount of damage Consume Spirit deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted creature or player is an illegal target by the time Consume Spirit would resolve, the entire spell is countered. You won't gain any life.

21.descricao:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

Crowd of Cinders's power and toughness are each equal to the number of black permanents you control.
21.texto: They envy the life-giving heat so much that they tear it from those who still possess it.

22.descricao: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
22.texto: The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off.—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook

23.texto: Imps are just intelligent enough to have an understanding of cruelty.

24.descricao: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.
24.texto:
The elves are right: Death inevitably leads to life. But the truly powerful don't just experience this cycle. They control it.
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

regras.texto: If the target creature or player is an illegal target when Essence Drain tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 3 life.

25.texto:
Those without beauty are Lorwyn's greatest tumor. The winnowers have an unpleasant duty, but a necessary one.
—Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana

26.texto:
It's a vicious circle. Stress breeds pain. Pain breeds stress. It's simply beautiful, wouldn't you agree?
-Vradeen, vampire nocturnus

27.texto:
“The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them.”
-Volrath

28.descricao: Target player discards X cards at random.
28.texto: Dark thoughts hatch and twist within the mind, straining to take wing.

29.descricao: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
29.texto: Winnowers live to eliminate eyeblights, creatures the elves deem too ugly to exist.

30.descricao:
Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.

{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.

31.descricao: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
31.texto: Nothing is sacred to rats. Everything is simply another meal.

32.descricao:
Flying

Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
32.texto: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.

regras.texto: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

33.descricao: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
33.texto: No one in Aphetto answers a knock at the door after sundown.

34.descricao: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

35.descricao: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to him or her.
35.texto:
In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan.
-Rabindranath Tagore

regras.texto: If multiple cards are drawn at once, this card triggers once for each card drawn.
In a multi-player game, it affects all opponents.

36.texto: Born under the moon, the second child will stumble on temptation and seek power in the dark places of the heart.—Codex of the Constellari

37.descricao: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
37.texto: Rage courses in every heart, yearning to betray its rational prison.—Sarkhan Vol

regras.texto: Act of Treason can target any creature, even one that's untapped or one you already control.
Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.
If you control a legendary creature and gain control of another legendary creature with the same name, you’ll choose one to remain on the battlefield and put the other into its owner’s graveyard.

38.descricao:
Banefire deals X damage to target creature or player.

If X is 5 or more, Banefire can't be countered by spells or abilities and the damage can't be prevented.
38.texto: For Sarkhan Vol, the dragon is the purest expression of life's savage splendor.

regras.texto: Banefire checks the number you chose for X, not the amount of mana you actually spent.

Banefire can be targeted by spells that try to counter it (such as Countersquall) regardless of what the value of X is. If X is 5 or more, those spells will still resolve, but the part of their effect that would counter Banefire won't do anything. Any other effects those spells have will work as normal.
Banefire's ability won't prevent it from being countered by the game rules if its target has become an illegal target.

39.descricao: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.

40.descricao: Red creatures you control have first strike.
40.texto: Boggarts divide the world into two categories: things you can eat, and things you have to chase down and pummel before you can eat.

41.descricao:
{T}: Cinder Pyromancer deals 1 damage to target player.

Whenever you cast a red spell, you may untap Cinder Pyromancer.
41.texto: If the whole world burns, I'll never grow cold.

42.texto: Earth elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

43.descricao: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
43.texto: The barbarians call it “touching the soul of a dragon”.

44.descricao: If a source would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.
44.texto: The furnace awaits the next master who would stoke the fires of apocalypse.

regras.texto: If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect. This means you can't normally end up with an odd amount of damage on something.
The trample rules cause damage to be divided before it is doubled.
If you have two of these on the battlefield, the damage is multiplied by 4.
The multiplied damage counts in all ways as if it came from the original source. Furnace of Rath is not the source.

If multiple effects modify how damage will be dealt, the player who would be dealt damage or the controller of the creature that would be dealt damage chooses the order to apply the effects. For example, Mending Hands says, "Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn." Suppose a spell would deal 5 damage to a player who has cast Mending Hands targeting himself or herself. That player can either (a) prevent 4 damage first and then let Furnace of Rath double the remaining 1 damage, taking 2 damage, or (b) double the damage to 10 and then prevent 4 damage, taking 6 damage.

45.texto: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.

46.descricao: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
46.texto: "The goblin word for ""flying"" is more accurately translated as ""falling slowly.""

47.texto: Fortunately, hill giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

48.descricao: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.

regras.texto: Regeneration abilities that would affect that creature can still be activated; they just won't do anything. The creature can't be regenerated for any reason, even if an effect other than Incinerate would deal lethal damage to it or otherwise destroy it.

Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

regras.texto: The Legend rule only applies to two legendary permanents with identical names. If the names are different, even if they depict the same character, the rule does not apply.

50.texto:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave.
-William Knox, ""Mortality""

regras.texto: This is the timeshifted version of Prodigal Sorcerer.

Flying

"[""Before armor, there was bark. Before blades, there were thorns.""

56.texto: These alleys are not safe. Come, I can guide you back to the market square.

Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

57.texto: The light of beauty protects our journeys through darkness.

58.descricao: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

59.descricao: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
59.texto: Wirewood cannot hide great size. Only with speed and skill can we survive here.

regras.texto: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block this.

60.descricao: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
60.texto:
For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high.
—Elvish hymn

regras.texto: It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.
This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

61.descricao: Sacrifice Elvish Eulogist: You gain 1 life for each Elf card in your graveyard.
61.texto: No matter how adept our artistic skill, our effigies can never hope to capture the vibrant beauty of a living elf. Perhaps that is truly why we mourn.

regras.texto: By the time this ability resolves, Elvish Eulogist will most likely be in your graveyard, so it will be counted by its own ability.

62.descricao: Put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield for each Elf you control.
62.texto: The faultless and immaculate castes form the lower tiers of elvish society, with the exquisite caste above them. At the pinnacle is the perfect, a consummate blend of aristocrat and predator.

63.descricao: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.
63.texto: Before any major undertaking, a Cylian elf seeks the guidance of a visionary to learn the will of the gargantuan ancients.

64.texto: As graceful as a deer leaping a stream and as deadly as the wolf waiting in ambush on the other side, elvish warriors are the eyes of the forest as well as its unsheathed claws.

65.texto: Gaea sings with the voice of nature rampant: a thousand howls, chitters, and cries, and none of them can be ignored.

regras.texto: The ability applies to your opponent's spells as well as your own.

66.descricao: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

67.descricao: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
67.texto: The giant spider's silk naturally resists gravity, almost weaving itself as it blankets the forest canopy.

regras.texto: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

68.texto: The other tribes call them fanatics, but none deny that the Mul Daya elves have an iron-strong bond to some force greater than themselves.

69.descricao: Put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield for each Forest you control.
69.texto: The murderous horrors of Raven's Run are legendary, but even that haunted place goes quiet when the night wolves howl.

regras.texto: The number of Wolves you put onto the battlefield is based on the number of Forests you control when Howl of the Night Pack resolves.
Howl of the Night Pack counts any land you control with the subtype Forest, not just ones named Forest.

70.descricao: {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature for each Elf you control.
70.texto: Elves of the immaculate class weave flora into living creatures—sometimes to endorse an elite warrior, sometimes to create a breathing work of art.

71.descricao:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.

{G}, {T}: Put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.
71.texto: In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.

72.descricao:
Jagged-Scar Archers's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves you control.

{T}: Jagged-Scar Archers deals damage equal to its power to target creature with flying.

73.descricao: Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.
73.texto: From the highest tiers of Dawn’s Light Palace to the deepest shade of Wren’s Run, the silver notes of the horn shimmer through the air, and all who hear it feel its pull.

74.descricao:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.

75.texto:
Jewels cannot be eaten nor gold drunk. What civilization trades, nature simply provides.
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

76.texto: If you want to destroy something lifeless, make it live.

77.descricao: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to your hand. (A permanent card is an artifact, creature, enchantment, land, or planeswalker card.)
77.texto: Like nature, the fern spirals back on itself, eternally seeking its own center.

78.descricao: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

regras.texto: Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

79.descricao: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
79.texto: Nature grows solutions to its problems.

regras.texto: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

81.descricao: Green creatures you control have trample.

82.texto: Bears aren’t always as strong and as mean as you imagine. Some are even stronger and meaner.

83.texto: Its spines act like the teeth of a saw, scoring distinctive marks in the vegetation of its territory.

84.descricao:
Trample

Cast Talara's Battalion only if you've cast another green spell this turn.

85.texto: Armodons are trained to step on things. Enemy things.

86.descricao:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

{1}{G}: Regenerate Troll Ascetic.

87.descricao: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
87.texto: Left to itself, nature overflows any container, overthrows any restriction, and overreaches any boundary.

regras.texto: Verdant Force's controller gets the tokens. That is the controller at the beginning of upkeep.
Once created, the tokens are independent of Verdant Force. If Verdant Force changes controllers, the new controller will put tokens onto the battlefield, but existing tokens will stay where they are.
In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.

88.descricao:
Trample

If damage would be dealt to a creature you control other than Vigor, prevent that damage. Put a +1/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.

When Vigor is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

regras.texto: The last ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into its owner's graveyard from any zone, not just from on the battlefield.

Although this ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it doesn't *specifically* trigger on leaving the battlefield, so it doesn't behave like other leaves-the-battlefield abilities. The ability will trigger from the graveyard.

If the Incarnation had lost this ability while on the battlefield (due to Lignify, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would still trigger and it would get shuffled into its owner's library. However, if the Incarnation lost this ability when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability wouldn't trigger and the Incarnation would remain in the graveyard.

If the Incarnation is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it won't get shuffled into its owner's library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has the Incarnation move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

89.texto: Orcish lumberjacks spent the night sharpening their blades and resting for a day of labor. They awoke to find that the forest had been making its own preparations.

90.descricao: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
90.texto: A banner for bonds of blood or belief.

regras.texto: If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
Sharing multiple creature types doesn't give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

91.descricao: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may gain 1 life.
91.texto: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.

regras.texto: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a black spell.
If a player casts a black spell, Demon's Horn's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Demon's Horn's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

92.descricao: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.
92.texto: Though no longer attached to the hand, it still holds its adversary in its grasp.

regras.texto: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a red spell.
If a player casts a red spell, Dragon's Claw's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Dragon's Claw's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

93.descricao: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.
93.texto: Bright as a mirror, dark as the sea.

regras.texto: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a blue spell.
If a player casts a blue spell, Kraken's Eye's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Kraken's Eye's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

94.descricao:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample and lifelink. (If the creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker. Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

95.descricao:
As The Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.

At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, The Rack deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in his or her hand.

regras.texto: You choose one opposing player as this card enters the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if this card changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if the chosen player leaves the battlefield.

96.descricao:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)

First strike
96.texto:
“A stick is your friend. A pointed stick is your good friend. An army of pointed sticks is your best friend.”
-Onean sergeant

97.descricao: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may gain 1 life.
97.texto: A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.

regras.texto: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a green spell.
If a player casts a green spell, Wurm's Tooth's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Wurm's Tooth's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.
